oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Major C. L. Greeno
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter affirms the good character of Samuel W. Duncan, formerly of 7th Penn. Cav. Regt., who joined the U. S. Army in Nashville early in 1864. Greeno notes that Duncan was always ready as a soldier and that he was with the regiment from Chattanooga to; Atlanta. The major writes that Duncan participated in Kilpatrick's Raid and was "one of the first to enter the enemies [sic] works" at Selma, Ala., in 1865. Greeno states that Duncan was one of the "most honorable and trustworthy men in the service."
